name: Graph Algorithms (BFS/DFS)
explanation: Graphs represent relationships between entities. BFS (Breadth-First Search) explores level by level using a queue, finds shortest paths in unweighted graphs. DFS (Depth-First Search) explores as deep as possible using recursion/stack, useful for pathfinding and cycle detection. Both have O(V + E) time complexity where V = vertices, E = edges. Used in social networks, routing, and dependency resolution.

examples.problem: BFS starting from node A in graph A-B, A-C, B-D
examples.solution: Visit order: A, B, C, D
steps: Dequeue A, add neighbors B, C: queue = [B, C]
Dequeue B, add neighbor D: queue = [C, D]
Order: A → B → C → D (level by level)

examples.solution: Visit order: A, B, D, C (or A, C, B, D depending on order)
steps: Go to B (first neighbor), mark visited
Go to D (neighbor of B), mark visited
Go to C (unvisited neighbor of A), mark visited
